title: Bears vs. Texans weather updates: NFL Hall of Fame game delayed as severe thunderstorms hit Canton | Sporting News Australia
text: After nearly three quarters of football's thunderous return, the 2024 NFL Hall of Fame game is delayed. Thunderstorms hit Canton, Ohio, resulting in the NFL suspending the Texans vs. Bears matchup. The two teams played until the 3:31 mark in the third quarter, with Chicago leading 21-17. Brett Rypien was one of three quarterbacks for the Bears and has thrown three touchdowns, including two in the second quarter. Chicago scored 14 unanswered points to take the lead after halftime. Here's the latest updates on weather the Bears vs. Texans game will return tonight. MORE: Live updates, highlights from Bears vs. Texans Hall of Fame game Bears vs. Texans weather updates 10:21 p.m. ET: The Bears vs. Texans game is still in delay as thunderstorms are hitting the Canton, Ohio area. Current conditions at suspendedâ€” Aaron Wilson (@AaronWilson_NFL) [@ProFootballHOF]game at Tom Benson Stadium [@KPRC2] [pic.twitter.com/5vXYYDMTcr] [August 2, 2024] It's expected to rain in Canton, Ohio over the next several hours, according to weather.com . The rain are expected to lighten up within the hour, which is somewhat promising for the game to resume. That said, it's uncertain how long the NFL is willing to wait for the rain to slow down. Rain is projected to hit Canton, Ohio all Friday and nearly all Saturday.
